Description: Pottery ostracon containing eighteen lines of of different Psalms written in Coptic. The Psalms mostly feature Zion, city of David.
Bibliographic references: Shaw & Nicholson 1995 / British Museum Dictionary of Ancient Egypt (p.72)
Hall 1905 / Coptic and Greek Texts of the Christian Period from Ostraka, Stelae, etc. in the British Museum (p.26, pl.20)
von Lemm 1908 / Koptische Miscellen LI-LXI (p.1335-37, no.6)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (111695) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/111695)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Brit.Mus.Copt. I 20:1 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
